subject: how to transcribe air and ear
msgSnippet: I notice that there seems to be some inconsistency on how to spell the words Air and Ear. Or it least it seems inconsistent to me. Here is a chart: word    IPA
messageBody:
I notice that there seems to be some inconsistency on how to spell the
words Air and Ear. Or it least it seems inconsistent to me. Here is a chart:

word IPA Literal QS Ligatures

air ɛər Ed Ado Roar Air

bear bɛər Bob Ed Ado Roar Bob Air

beer bɪər Bob Eat Ado Roar Bob Ear

ear ɪər Eat Ado Roar Ear


The problem I see is that the ligatures don't match the literal QS.
"Air" consists of 3 sounds, and none of them involve Eight, one of the
pairs in the ligature Air.

Likewise, "Ear" also contains 3 sounds, none of them containing the
sound "Ed," one of the pairs in the ligature Ear.

Paul

I notice that there seems to be some inconsistency on how to spell the 
words Air and Ear. Or it least it seems inconsistent to me. Here is a chart:

word    IPA      Literal QS           Ligatures

air      ɛər      Ed Ado Roar          Air

bear     bɛər     Bob Ed Ado Roar      Bob Air

beer     bɪər     Bob Eat Ado Roar     Bob Ear

ear      ɪər      Eat Ado Roar         Ear


The problem I see is that the ligatures don't match the literal QS. 
"Air" consists of 3 sounds, and none of them involve Eight, one of the 
pairs in the ligature Air.

Likewise, "Ear" also contains 3 sounds, none of them containing the 
sound "Ed," one of the pairs in the ligature Ear.

Paul
